Courses.Name: CBE 2206A - INTRO INDUSTRIAL ORGANIC CHEM
Description: This course presents the fundamental principles governing the structure and reactivity of organic molecules. Organic molecules form the basis of industrial chemical and environmental processes. The laboratory section focuses on bench scale processing of organic chemical products, and the use of modern instruments for analysis of organic materials and monitoring of chemical processes.
Antirequisite(s): Chemistry 2213A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 3 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL AND GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Chemistry 1302A/B or the former Chemistry 1024A/B.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL AND GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Chemistry 1302A/B or the former Chemistry 1024A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 2207B - APPLIED INDUSTRIAL ORG CHEM
Description: This course applies previously learned concepts in organic chemistry to describe chemical transformations that form the basis of industrial and environmental processes. The laboratory section focuses on the bench scale synthesis of organic chemical products, and the use of modern instruments for their analysis and quality control.
Antirequisite(s): Chemistry 2223B or the former CBE 2216.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 3 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2206A/B.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2206A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 2214A - ENGINEERING THERMODYNAMICS
Description: Properties of a pure substance, first law of thermodynamics, processes in open and closed systems, second law of thermodynamics; ideal gases, mixture of ideal gases, and psychometry, compressors and energy conversion systems.
Antirequisite(s): MME 2204A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL AND GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 1411A/B.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL AND GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 1411A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 2220A - CHEMICAL PROCESS CALCULATIONS
Description: The objective of this course is to introduce the fundamental concepts of

material and energy balances which form the basis of chemical and biochemical engineering processes. Calculations related to specific problems in these fields are carried out. New directions in chemical and biochemical engineering are introduced.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL, INTEGRATED  AND GREEN  PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 1411A/B, Applied Mathematics 1414A/B, Chemistry 1302A/B, Physics 1401A/B and Physics 1402A/B.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL, INTEGRATED  AND GREEN  PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 1411A/B, Applied Mathematics 1414A/B, Chemistry 1302A/B, Physics 1401A/B and Physics 1402A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 2221B - FLUID FLOW
Description: To introduce chemical engineering students to the basics of momentum transfer and fluid flow; their application to the solution of engineering problems. Topics include: conservation of mass, momentum and energy, flow of fluids, measurement of fluid flow, laminar and turbulent flow, compressible and incompressible flow, pumps, nozzles, flow meters, turbines.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 3 tutorial/lab hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL, INTEGRATED  AND GREEN  PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 1414A/B.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL, INTEGRATED  AND GREEN  PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 1414A/B.
HELD IN SEB 1081.
HELD IN SEB 1081.
HELD IN SEB 1081.

Courses.Name: CBE 2224B - CHEMICAL ENG THERMODYNAMICS
Description: Provides the basics of the thermodynamics involved in chemical engineering with emphasis on material and energy balances, thermo physics, thermo chemistry, and thermodynamics of chemical processes. Emphasis is placed on the application of thermodynamics to practical problems in phase equilibria and on solutions and reaction equilibria in separations and reaction engineering.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL AND GREEN PROCESS  ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2214A/B or MME 2204A/B, Applied Mathematics 1414A/B.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL AND GREEN PROCESS  ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2214A/B or MME 2204A/B, Applied Mathematics 1414A/B.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL AND GREEN PROCESS  ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2214A/B or MME 2204A/B, Applied Mathematics 1414A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 2290A - FUNDAMENTALS OF BIOCHEM AND EN
Description: The overall objective of the course is to apply the principles of microbiology, biochemistry to understand and solve environmental problems. This course covers the fundamental concepts of biological processes that are important in natural and engineered environmental systems. Students will gain basic skills of biochemistry and microbiology in laboratory section.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 3 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL, GREEN PROCESS AND INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Chemistry 1302A/B or the former Chemistry 1024A/B.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL, GREEN PROCESS AND INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Chemistry 1302A/B or the former Chemistry 1024A/B.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL, GREEN PROCESS AND INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Chemistry 1302A/B or the former Chemistry 1024A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 2291B - COMPUTATNL METHD FOR ENGINEERS
Description: This course is designed to introduce the student to technical computing for Engineers and Scientists using the high level, interactive, computational tools provided by the Matlab-Simulink Environment. Students will learn both the object oriented programming and command line modes of Matlab and apply them to the solution of a variety of problems involving optimization and dynamic simulation of Engineering processes.
Antirequisite(s): CEE 2219A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL, INTEGRATED  AND GREEN  PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1036A/B or Computer Science 1026A/B.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL, INTEGRATED  AND GREEN  PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1036A/B or Computer Science 1026A/B.
ALSO HELD IN HSB 14.

Courses.Name: CBE 3307A - ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT
Description: An overview of energy conversion efficiency and related environmental impact aspects in the chemical engineering industry.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours per week, 1 tutorial hour per week.

Notes: CROSS-LISTED WITH GPE 3384A.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2221A/B, CBE 2290A/B and CBE 2214A/B.
CROSS-LISTED WITH GPE 3384A.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2221A/B, CBE 2290A/B and CBE 2214A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 3310B - PROCESS DYNAMICS & CONTROL
Description: The course covers the dynamic behavior, modeling and control of chemical processes. The principles of feedback control of commonly-encountered systems such as level, flow, temperature, pressure, are described. Theory is introduced to illustrate current practice. Simulations of dynamic behavior of processes will make use of the MATLAB/Simulink programming environment.
Antirequisite(s): The former CBE 4410A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 laboratory hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL, INTEGRATED OR GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2277A/B, CBE 2291A/B.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL, INTEGRATED OR GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2277A/B, CBE 2291A/B.
ALSO HELD IN HSB 16.

Courses.Name: CBE 3315A - REACTION ENGINEERING
Description: Chemical kinetics as applied to the large-scale manufacture of chemicals. An introduction to the factors which affect the design and size of chemical reactors, as well as the conditions under which they are to be operated for maximum efficiency.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1.5 laboratory hours, 2 tutorial hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 1414A/B, CBE 2224A/B and Chemistry 1302A/B.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 1414A/B, CBE 2224A/B and Chemistry 1302A/B.
PRIORITY TO CHEMICAL OPTION B STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: CBE 3316B - SUSTAINABLE CHEM ENGG. & LCA
Description: An introduction to the approaches used to evaluate the environmental impacts of chemical technology and processes such as energy conversion, food production, transportation and waste management. This course will also focus on the application of green engineering concepts in chemical process design and evaluation.
Antirequisite(s): GPE 3382A/B, GPE 3386A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours per week, 1 tutorial hour per week.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2214A/B.
Corequisite(s): CBE 3319A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2214A/B.
Corequisite(s): CBE 3319A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2214A/B.
Corequisite(s): CBE 3319A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 3318A - INTRO TO CHEMICAL PROCESS SIM
Description: This course aims to introduce and to develop student skills on modern methods for simulation of chemical process units.  Differential heat balance, mass balance.  Energy and material balance methods in process units.  Executive systems for overall balance methods.  Physical properties, computer packages.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL OR GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1050, CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2221A/B, and either CBE 2224A/B.
PRIORITY TO CHEMICAL OPTION B.

Courses.Name: CBE 3319B - INTRO TO PLANT DESIGN & SAFETY
Description: This course introduces students to chemical processes, analysis and design considering safety, environment and economics. Students will be exposed to fundamental aspects of chemical process design and integration of safety from theoretical and practical perspective. Students will be also provided with detailed review and analysis of major accidents in chemical industry and preventive measures.
Antirequisite(s): GPE 3382A/B.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 2 tutorial hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1050, CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2221A/B, and either CBE 2224A/B.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1050, CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2221A/B, and either CBE 2224A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 3322A - HEAT TRANSFER OPERATIONS
Description: Introduce chemical engineering students to the basics of heat transfer, including conduction, convection, radiation and phase change. This knowledge will be used for the design of various types of equipment such as heat exchangers with and without phase change agitated reactors, evaporators, condensers.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL, GREEN PROCESS AND INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2221A/B, or registration in the Integrated Engineering program.
Corequisite(s): CBE 3395Y, or CBE 3396Y, or GPE 3395Y, or registration in the Integrated Engineering program.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL, GREEN PROCESS AND INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2221A/B, or registration in the Integrated Engineering program.
Corequisite(s): CBE 3395Y, or CBE 3396Y, or GPE 3395Y, or registration in the Integrated Engineering program.

Courses.Name: CBE 3323B - STAGED OPERATIONS
Description: This course will focus on the staged unit operations in chemical engineering. It is designed to familiarize the students with the nature and theory of chemical engineering unit operations, analysis and physical separation processes based on the ideal stage concept.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL OR GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2221A/B, CBE 2224A/B.
Corequisite(s): CBE 3395Y or CBE 3396Y or GPE 3395Y.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL OR GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2221A/B, CBE 2224A/B.
Corequisite(s): CBE 3395Y or CBE 3396Y or GPE 3395Y.

Courses.Name: CBE 3324B - MASS TRANSFER OPERATIONS
Description: This course reviews the fundamentals of interphase mass transfer and transfer units and then reviews the design of differential mass transfer equipment, with special emphasis on absorption, stripping, humidification and drying.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL AND GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2221A/B.
Corequisite(s): CBE 3395Y or CBE 3396Y or GPE 3395Y.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL AND GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2221A/B.
Corequisite(s): CBE 3395Y or CBE 3396Y or GPE 3395Y.
RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL AND GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2221A/B.
Corequisite(s): CBE 3395Y or CBE 3396Y or GPE 3395Y.

Courses.Name: CBE 3330A - BIOREACTION & BIOPROCESS ENG
Description: This course focuses on enzyme, kinetics and bioreactor engineering; homogeneous and immobilized enzyme technology; microbial cell processes; free suspended and immobilized cell processes; batch and continuous bioreactor operation; oxygen mass transfer; aeration, agitation and mixing; sterilization of gases and liquids; basics of bioreactor scale-up.
Antirequisite(s): CBE 3301A/B and CBE 3320A/B.
Extra Information:3 lecture hours, 3 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 3 CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS IN THE BIOCHEM OPTION.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2290A/B.
Corequisite(s): CBE 3315A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YR 3 CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS IN THE BIOCHEM OPTION.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2290A/B.
Corequisite(s): CBE 3315A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 3395Y - CHEMICAL ENGINEERING LAB
Description: This laboratory course applies and integrates concepts/theories presented in the following four courses: CBE 3322A/B, CBE 3323A/B, CBE 3324A/B, and CBE 3325A/B .
Antirequisite(s): GPE 3395Y, or CBE 3396Y.
Extra Information: 3 laboratory hours

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Corequisite(s): CBE 3322A/B, CBE 3323A/B, CBE 3324A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 3396Y - BIOCHEM ENGINEERING LAB COURSE
Description: This laboratory course applies and integrates concepts/theories presented in the following five courses: CBE 3322A/B, CBE 3323A/B, CBE 3324A/B, CBE 3325A/B and CBE 3330A/B.
Antirequisite(s): CBE 3395Y.
Extra Information: 3 laboratory hours.

Notes: REQUISITES: Corequisite(s): CBE 3322A/B, CBE 3323A/B, CBE 3324A/B, CBE 3330A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 4403B - BIOCHEMICAL SEPARATION PROCESS
Description: The main objective of this course is to introduce the student to the basic fundamentals of downstream separation and purification processes such as membrane separation processes, protein separation and purification and other separation processes of economic importance to fermentation industry.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 OR 4 CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2290A/B, or Biology 1001A and Biology 1002B.
RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 OR 4 CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2290A/B, or Biology 1001A and Biology 1002B.

Courses.Name: CBE 4405B - AIR POLLUTION CONTROL
Description: The nature, effects and mitigation strategies for air pollution including the structure and physical behavior of the atmosphere, types and origins of air pollutants, chemical reactions in the atmosphere, atmospheric dispersion, techniques of pollutant evaluation, control, surveys and effects of air pollution on health and other aspects of urban and natural environments.
Antirequisite(s): CEE 4405A/B.
Extra Information: 3.0 lecture hours, 1.0 tutorial hours.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CEE 2224 or CBE 2221A/B or MME 2273A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CEE 2224 or CBE 2221A/B or MME 2273A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 4409B - WASTEWATER TREATMENT
Description: This course introduces a basic understanding of municipal wastewater treatment processes. The course reviews pertinent environmental regulations, and general wastewater quality parameters. Processes and unit operations in wastewater treatment are introduced with particular emphasis on process design. Considerations in integrating unit processes and operations into a treatment system are presented.
Antirequisite(s): The former CBE 3363A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 3 OR 4 CHEMICAL, OR YR 4 GREEN PROCESS, INTEGRATED OR YR 3 CIVIL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2290A/B or CEE 2217A/B or Chemistry 2210A/B

Courses.Name: CBE 4411A - ENGINEERING COFFEE
Description: This course combines and demonstrates chemical engineering principles using coffee as a teaching tool. Experiential learning will include hands-on applications of concepts through multiple lab activities and an examination of a local café through a case-based learning activity.
Extra information: 3 lab hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: REGISTRATION BY PERMISSION OF DEPARTMENT
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2221A/B, CBE 3322A/B, CBE 3323A/B, CBE 3324A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 4415 - CHEMICAL ENGINEERING PROJECT
Description: Selection and investigation of an engineering problem. Analytical and/or experimental work is carried out by individual students under the supervision of a faculty member. Progress reports, a final engineering report and a public lecture are required. It is the responsibility of the student to identify a supervisor and suitable engineering problem for investigation before registering in the course.
Antirequisite(s): CBE 4425, GPE 4415, CEE 4440, MME 4410.
Extra Information: 6 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of third year of the Chemical Engineering program with a minimum 78% third year term average and permission of the department.

Courses.Name: CBE 4416A - CARBON FOOTPRINT & MANAGEMENT
Description: An overview of the main sources of CO2 emissions, their comparative impacts and the emerging technologies for CO2 management. The course focuses on the technical details associated with CO2 capture and storage and the practical challenges associated with implementation of these technologies.
Antirequisite(s): CBE 4413A/B.
Extra Information: 3.0 lecture hours, 1.0 tutorial hours.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 3315A/B or GPE 3315A/B; CBE 3324A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 3315A/B or GPE 3315A/B; CBE 3324A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 4421A - INTRO TO BIOMATERIALS ENGINRNG
Description: An introduction of materials science and engineering topics. 2. The four materials classes (metals, ceramics, polymers, composites) will be addressed with emphasis upon the material types and material properties pertinent to their use in implanted medical devices. 3. The structure and properties of biologic tissues and biocompatibility. 4. Specific implant applications will be addressed.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 OR 4 CHEMICAL OR YR 4 GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING OR YR 4 INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS OR YR 3 CHEMICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1021A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 OR 4 CHEMICAL OR YR 4 GREEN PROCESS ENGINEERING OR YR 4 INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS OR YR 3 CHEMICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1021A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 4422B - NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY
Description: Nanobiotechnology is an emerging frontier in nanotechnology. It integrates materials science, chemical engineering, physics and life science toward the biological and biochemical applications. This course introduces the fundamental concepts of nanobiotechnology and the upto-date application of nanotechnology in biomedical industries.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of third year of the Chemical Engineering program.
RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of third year of the Chemical Engineering program.

Courses.Name: CBE 4423B - TISSUE ENGINEERING
Description: Integrates principles of engineering and life sciences towards the fundamental understanding of structure-function relationships in normal and pathological mammalian tissues. The course will cover the applications of engineering design concepts and molecular cell biology to understand the development of biological substitutes to restore, maintain or improve tissue/organ function.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2290A/B, CBE 2221A/B, CBE 3322A/B, CBE 3324A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2290A/B, CBE 2221A/B, CBE 3322A/B, CBE 3324A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 4425 - BIOCHEM & ENV ENGINEER PROJECT
Description: Selection and investigation of a biochemical engineering problem. Analytical and/or experimental work is carried out by individual students under the supervision of a faculty member. Progress reports, a final engineering report and a public lecture are required. It is the responsibility of the student to identify a supervisor and suitable engineering problem for investigation before registering in the course.
Antirequisite(s): GPE 4415, CBE 4415, CEE 4440, MME 4410.
Extra Information: 6 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS IN THE BIOCHEM OPTION.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of third year of the Chemical Engineering program with a minimum 78% third year term average and permission of the department.

Courses.Name: CBE 4428A - INTRO TO NANOENGINEERING
Description: An introduction to fundamental concepts in nanoengineering, emphasizing limitations of macroscale models and presenting alternative molecular approaches to the engineering of nanoscale systems.
Extra Information: 3.0 lecture hours, 1.0 tutorial hours.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2277A/B or Applied Mathematics 2276A/B; CBE 2214A/B or MME 2204A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2277A/B or Applied Mathematics 2276A/B; CBE 2214A/B or MME 2204A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 4432A - ENERGY & FUELS PRD SYSTEMS
Description: This course introduces students to different sources of energy and fuels and their production systems, operations, feedstock and products characteristics. Description of main conversion processes and their evolution will be discussed in the context of environmental and economic considerations. Current trends and future of the industry will be addressed.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2206A/B, CBE 3315A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2206A/B, CBE 3315A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2206A/B, CBE 3315A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 4485B - ENERGY AND SOCIETY
Description: Energy is the greatest challenge facing humanity in the 21st century. This course will cover the historical aspects of energy conversion and use by humans, the types of energy available (including both renewable and non-renewable), their conversion to useful forms of energy, conversion efficiency, and cost of conversion. A very important aspect of the course is the environmental effect of energy conversion. The atmospheric pollution by greenhouse gases as well as conventional pollutants during energy conversion will be discussed. The main methods of pollution reduction by power industries will be presented.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2220A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2220A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 4493B - POLYMER ENGINEERING
Description: The basics of polymer science and engineering are covered. The theory of macromolecules, macromolecular chemistry and fundamentals of polymerization are discussed. Specific manufacturing processes and polymer types are considered.
Antirequisite(s): Chemistry 3320A/B, the former CBE 3392A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2207A/B or Chemistry 2213A/B and Chemistry 2223B or the former Chemistry 2216, or GPE 2214A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2207A/B or Chemistry 2213A/B and Chemistry 2223B or the former Chemistry 2216, or GPE 2214A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 4497 - CHEMICAL PROCESS & PLNT DESIGN
Description: A design is prepared for a full-scale chemical process. This involves the detailed design of all major pieces of equipment, an estimate of the requirements for new materials and energy, and a calculation of total costs. Problem formulation, alternative design solutions and professional decision making are emphasized.
Antirequisite(s): GPE 4497, CEE 4441, ECE 4416, MME 4499, SE 4450, ES 4499, MSE 4499, ECE 4415.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 3 tutorial hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 CHEMICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS AND YR 4 CHEMICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 2220A/B, CBE 2224A/B, CBE 3315A/B, CBE 3322A/B, CBE 3323A/B, CBE 3324A/B, and CBE 3318A/B and CBE 3319A/B.

Courses.Name: CBE 4498 - BIOCHEM PROCESS & PLANT DESIGN
Description: A design is prepared for a full-scale biochemical process. This involves the detailed design of all major pieces of equipment, an estimate of the requirements for new materials and energy, and a calculation of total costs. Problem formulation, alternative design solutions and professional decision making are emphasized.
Antirequisite(s): CBE 4497, CEE 4441, ECE 4415, ECE 4416, ES 4499, GPE 4497, MME 4499, MSE 4499, SE 4450.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 3 tutorial hours.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): CBE 3315A/B, CBE 3318A/B, CBE 3319A/B, CBE 3322A/B, CBE 3323A/B, CBE 3324A/B, CBE 3330A/B.
